name: Chicken Pizza
description: Not sure what to do with your leftover 20-Minute Rotisserie Chicken? Add it to pizza! Easily make your own gluten-free crust or cut down on time with a premade shell.

ingredients.name: cooked and cubed chicken, such as leftover Rotisserie Chicken

preparation: Combine the dry ingredients for the crust in a medium bowl.
Whisk the olive oil, water, and egg together. Mix with dry ingredients to form a dough.
On a Sheet Pan lined with a Sheet Pan Liner, press dough out into desired shape and thickness.
Top crust with Marinara Sauce, chicken, and bell peppers. Bake for 12–15 minutes until crust starts to brown. Top with spinach, cut into slices, and serve.
tips: Cook once, eat twice. For a speedy roast chicken, microwave Rotisserie Chicken in the Round Steamer for 20 min. Use up leftovers for pizza, salads, and sandwiches.
For an even speedier pizza, use an 11" whole-grain pizza shell (it will serve 4 instead of 6).
Make it vegetarian: Swap chicken for tofu.
perfectlyBalanceYourPlate: Serve with 1 cup mixed greens and 1 tbsp Epicure salad dressing.

products.name: 3 Onion Dip Mix
summary: These onions won’t make you cry—they’re pure happiness in a jar! Save time (and tears) on chopping and use this blend anytime you’re looking for the robust flavour of onions, chives, and scallions. Take it way beyond the dip bowl and use 3 Onion as a sauce or seasoning for eggs, veggies, burgers, tacos, and more!

products.name: Marinara Sauce Mix
summary: A simple, kid-friendly sauce that speaks volumes, Marinara is packed with the bright flavour of garlic, oregano, and basil. Pair it with your fave pasta and use it as a base layer for delicious homemade pizza.

products.name: Sheet Pan
summary: Lightweight all-purpose baking sheet made from a single piece of aluminum, with a one-inch rim.

products.name: Sheet Pan Liner
summary: Nonstick silicone baking sheet. Ideal for baking, roasting, sheet pan meals & more!
